org.digijava.kernel.job.cachedtables

Class PublicViewColumnsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.kernel.job.cachedtables.PublicViewColumnsUtil

  • public class PublicViewColumnsUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities regarding cached_ variants of reports' extractor tables / views

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean CRASH_ON_INVALID_COLUMNS
      only change this to false when you have REALLY good reasons for this and ONLY WHILE TESTING OTHER STUFF
      NEVER RUN ANY AMP 2.7+ PRODUCTION INSTANCE WITH THIS SET TO false !!! Злой маньяк Constantin is taking care that this rule is enforced!
      protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger logger 
      protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> supplementalCachedViews
      the views/tables which should be cached for the public view even though they are not extractor columns

      returns Map
      static java.lang.String getPublicViewTable(java.lang.String extractorView) 
      protected static boolean looksLikeIndexableColumn(java.lang.String viewName, java.lang.String columnName)
      decides whether a particular column of a particular view should have an index on top of it.
      current implementation is a quick-and-dirty-and-good-enough heuristics which ignores the viewName.
      static void maintainPublicViewCaches(java.sql.Connection conn, boolean updateData)
      strategy of this function: non-existing tables will always be created and populated existing_and_correct tables will dropped, created and updated if updateData = true existing but faulty tables will be dropped and recreated if updateData = true
      static void redoCaches()
      unconditionally redoes all the public view caches

      • CRASH_ON_INVALID_COLUMNS

        public static final boolean CRASH_ON_INVALID_COLUMNS
        only change this to false when you have REALLY good reasons for this and ONLY WHILE TESTING OTHER STUFF
        NEVER RUN ANY AMP 2.7+ PRODUCTION INSTANCE WITH THIS SET TO false !!! Злой маньяк Constantin is taking care that this rule is enforced!

      • maintainPublicViewCaches

        public static void maintainPublicViewCaches(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                            boolean updateData)
        strategy of this function:
        • non-existing tables will always be created and populated
        • existing_and_correct tables will dropped, created and updated if updateData = true
        • existing but faulty tables will be dropped and recreated if updateData = true
        Parameters:
        conn -
        updateSchemaIfDifferent -
        updateData - if false, only check & update database scheme; if true - update data unconditionally

      • createTableCache

        protected static void createTableCache(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                       java.lang.String viewName,
                                       java.lang.String cacheName)
        drops a table and replaces it with DDL, data and indices of a view/table

        viewName -
        cacheName -

      • looksLikeIndexableColumn

        protected static boolean looksLikeIndexableColumn(java.lang.String viewName,
                                                  java.lang.String columnName)
        decides whether a particular column of a particular view should have an index on top of it.
        current implementation is a quick-and-dirty-and-good-enough heuristics which ignores the viewName. For cases when the heuristics fails, hardcoded cases can be added
        Parameters:
        viewName -
        columnName -
        Returns:
